title: 114_s2119
content: The President must submit a detailed report to Congress on the IAEA's final assessment of Iran's nuclear program within 30 days. A briefing will also be provided on how outstanding issues were resolved. Additionally, a statement of policy on the effective re-imposition of sanctions is included. The United States and its European allies are prepared to re-impose sanctions on Iran if it fails to meet its JCPOA commitments. The US will enforce violations of the JCPOA and ensure a range of tools are available to respond to Iran's non-performance. European allies will join in re-imposing sanctions if Iran violates the JCPOA incrementally. SEC. 14. UNITED STATES COORDINATOR FOR THE JOINT COMPREHENSIVE PLAN OF ACTION. The President shall designate a special coordinator within the Department of State for compliance with the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action on Iran's nuclear program. The Coordinator, appointed by the President, will coordinate all activities related to the implementation of the JCPOA. The special coordinator within the Department of State will monitor Iran's compliance with the JCPOA, track noncompliance incidents, and coordinate with other agencies to investigate and designate individuals supporting Iran's ballistic missile activities. The Coordinator will monitor Iran's compliance with the JCPOA, track noncompliance incidents related to ballistic missiles or terrorism, and assess the use of funds by the Government of Iran. Consultations will be held with Congress, NGOs, and international organizations as needed. SEC. 15. UNIFIED POLICY ON ARMS AND BALLISTIC AND CRUISE MISSILE SALES TO IRAN. Congress believes Iran should be prohibited from activities involving nuclear-capable ballistic or cruise missiles, and UN member states must prevent technology transfer to Iran for such activities. SEC. 16. INTERNATIONAL ATOMIC ENERGY AGENCY. The sense of Congress is that the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) should have adequate funding, manpower, and authority for verification responsibilities under the JCPOA. The President should work with international partners to ensure the IAEA receives an additional $10,600,000 annually for this purpose. The President is required to submit reports every 180 days on efforts to achieve this goal and any obstacles. Authorization is given for necessary appropriations from 2016 to 2026. The United States will provide necessary funding to meet its annual commitments to the IAEA and additional funds for verification responsibilities under the JCPOA or related agreements from 2016 to 2026. SEC. 17. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, "appropriate congressional committees" refer to specific committees in the Senate and House of Representatives. "Appropriate congressional committees and leadership" include these committees and key leaders in both chambers. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action and the intelligence community as specified in the National Security Act of 1947.
